bibl.title: A New Papyrus from the Family Archive of Dioskoros of Aphrodito and the Mysterious Phoibammon (P. Mich. inv. 1051).
bibl.note: Tax receipt. Aphrodito, 524/5 A.D. (?). The appearance of Phoibammon as agent of Apollos, son of Dioskoros, in conjunction with the tentative dating of this and other similar receipts sheds light on the early years of Phoibammon, son of Triadelphos, entrepreneur of Aphrodito.
bibl.seg: GAGOS Traianos, A New Papyrus from the Family Archive of Dioskoros of Aphrodito and the Mysterious Phoibammon (P. Mich. inv. 1051).

Tax receipt. Aphrodito, 524/5 A.D. (?). The appearance of Phoibammon as agent of Apollos, son of Dioskoros, in conjunction with the tentative dating of this and other similar receipts sheds light on the early years of Phoibammon, son of Triadelphos, entrepreneur of Aphrodito.
